intro: Micromeria filiformis subsp. cordata, commonly known as the narrowleaf micromeria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, yellowish flowers that appear in clusters. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. The subspecies cordata is distinguished by its more elongated and narrower leaves compared to other subspecies of Micromeria.
